intro: Acronia galerita, commonly known as the common acronia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a mild scent when crushed. Acronia galerita is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and soil stability.
